alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Seminole and central Volusia Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Helen. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Daytona Beach, DeLand, Lake Helen and Osteen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
